item.title: New publication
item.description:
The results of the NTMscope-Eco project are published!

Non-tuberculous mycobacteria are ubiquitous environmental organisms that can often be found in aquatic environments. In this, study we investigated their presence in household water samples from Germany. The NTM-species most frequently detected were M. chelonae and M. chimaera. When set into a global context by whole genome sequencing, the strains turned out to be part of globally distributed lineages.

You can find the full publication via the journal's homepage or the MIRU website.
